name: Hatchpad
description:
Hatchpad’s mission is to connect rental communities.

We unify the rental experience for tenants and letting agents from search all the way through to contract signature and moving in. 

Our secure cloud-based platform handles the viewings and automates the whole administrative process from start to finish; re-shaping the rental experience for both the tenant as well as the agent.

Hatchpad gives letting agents more time to focus on bringing on new landlords without having to spend so much time on the viewings and administration. We are revolutionising the whole rental experience for the tenant(s) whilst they search and sign for their new property.

team.name: Alex Gnyla
team.bioHtml: Successfully bootstrapped Redbrick bills to turnover £1.2 million annually. Launching sister company hatchpad to transform student lettings industry.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.description:
You will be the first technical hire for the company. The ideal candidate will be someone senior with at least 3 years’ worth of experience as a full-stack developer in a variety of roles. If you have some experience with server maintenance as well, that can be even better. I am looking for someone who I can get on well with and who will not only write the code but will also lead the technological aspect of the business.

You will be mentored by an experienced CTO who will guide and assist you to grow within your role and within our company.

Required:

•	At least two years’ experience with Laravel Framework and PHP.
•	Very good experience with MySQL database (knowledge of additional ones is a plus).
•	Knowledge of web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6), etc.
•	At least two years’ experience in front-end technologies such as React or Angular.
•	Experience with writing and consuming RESTful APIs.
•	Good knowledge of OOP, Agile practices and best coding practices.


Desirable:

•	Knowledge of NoSQL databases.
•	Experience with React Native / other mobile technologies.
•	Experience with AWS services and maintenance.
•	Understanding of SASS (or LESS).


You will also need:

•	Good communication skills (writing and verbal).
•	To be a team player.
•	You are a self-motivated individual with a willingness to learn.
•	Be able to explain technical concepts and decisions to non-techies.
•	Be passionate about technology and best practices as well as leadership.
•	To have (or have the willingness to acquire) some basic business understanding.
•	Aspiration to grow professionally and manage others in the future.
